result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher C Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine.  Balance to be paid in full by 08-01-2016 or serve 2 days jail as penalty for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher C Williams

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Cameron Weitzner in court.   
Defendant Christopher C Williams did not appear.   

State moves to amend to County Ordinance of DC.
Defense has no objections.

Atty. Weitzner enters a plea of No Contest to the amended charge on behalf of his client.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge:


Court orders the following:
Fine:  $330.50
Apply Bail.
Balance to be in full by:  08/01/16
Alternate:  2 Days in the Waukesha County Jail
Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.   COURT ORDERED A $250.00 CASH BOND IN ADDITION TO A $750.00 SIGNATURE BOND.
